data.text:
Tubi TV Releases New Lineup of Free Streaming Movie Offerings for February 2017

The World’s Largest Free Streaming TV Library Adds New Titles, Ranging From Indie and Classics to Horror and Comedies

SAN FRANCISCO, CA – January 25, 2017 – Tubi TV, the largest truly free Internet TV network with no subscription fee requirement, today announced a new slate of February movies. These audience favorites join the largest free collection of premium and unique movies and TV shows available anywhere, featuring Oscar-winning movies, Emmy-winning TV shows, classics, family and kids content, telenovelas, Korean dramas, stand-up comedy, horror, and much more.

Just in time for Valentine’s Day, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Bobby Cannavale, Laura Dern, Lisa Kudrow, Steve Coogan, and Tom Arnold explore love and relationships in Happy Endings. Indie fans can also cuddle up with Transparent showrunner Jill Soloway’s Afternoon Delight or Terry Zwigoff’s Art School Confidential. Meanwhile classic cinephiles can fall for Orson Welles essential The Stranger.

Whether viewers want to snuggle closer to someone they love in fear–or avoid mention of the L-word entirely–Tubi TV has plenty of scares this February. Horror movie lovers have their pick of found-footage favorite The Blair Witch Project, six outings in the Leprechaun franchise, The Haunting In Connecticut 2: Ghosts Of Georgia, and more.

Below is the complete list of new February 2017 Tubi TV movies and titles leaving Tubi TV in February (last chance to watch), which you can watch for free at http://tubitv.com, on Android and iOS mobile devices, as well as OTT devices such as Roku, Apple TV, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Samsung, and Amazon Fire TV:

About Tubi TV

Tubi TV is the free Internet TV network that offers the largest collection of movies and TV shows. Led by a team of passionate entertainment and technology enthusiasts based in San Francisco, Tubi TV is freeing premium movies and TV shows so viewers can be entertained without the hassle of subscription fees or credit cards. Commercials ensure that Tubi TV remains free for everyone.

Find Tubi TV on Android and iOS mobile devices, and on OTT devices such as Roku, Apple TV, Chromecast, Xbox 360, Xbox One, Samsung and Amazon Fire TV. Watch on the web at http://tubitv.com.

Become a fan of Tubi TV on Facebook or follow on Twitter to keep up with all the latest catalogue changes.
